verses.text: Wine \add is\add* a mocker, strong drink \add is\add* raging: And whosoever is deceived thereby is not wise.
The fear of a king \add is\add* as the roaring of a lion: \add Whoso\add* provoketh him to anger sinneth \add against\add* his own soul.
\add It is\add* an honour for a man to cease from strife: But every fool will be meddling.
The sluggard will not plow by reason of the cold; Therefore shall he beg in harvest, and \add have\add* nothing.
Counsel in the heart of man \add is like\add* deep water; But a man of understanding will draw it out.
Most men will proclaim every one his own goodness: But a faithful man who can find?
The just \add man\add* walketh in his integrity: His children \add are\add* blessed after him.
A king that sitteth in the throne of judgment Scattereth \add away\add* all evil with his eyes.
Who can say, I have made my heart clean, I am pure from my sin?
Divers weights, \add and\add* divers measures, Both of them \add are\add* alike abomination to the \sc Lord\sc*.
Even a child is known by his doings, Whether his work \add be\add* pure, and whether \add it be\add* right.
The hearing ear, and the seeing eye, The \sc Lord\sc* hath made even both of them.
Love not sleep, lest thou come to poverty; Open thine eyes, \add and\add* thou shalt be satisfied \add with\add* bread.
\add It is\add* naught, \add it is\add* naught, saith the buyer: But when he is gone his way, then he boasteth.
There is gold, and a multitude of rubies: But the lips of knowledge \add are\add* a precious jewel.
Take his garment that is surety \add for\add* a stranger: And take a pledge of him for a strange \add woman\add*.
Bread of deceit \add is\add* sweet to a man; But afterwards his mouth shall be filled \add with\add* gravel.
Every purpose is established by counsel: And with good advice make war.
He that goeth about \add as\add* a talebearer revealeth secrets: Therefore meddle not with him that flattereth \add with\add* his lips.
Whoso curseth his father or his mother, His lamp shall be put out in obscure darkness.
An inheritance \add may be\add* gotten hastily at the beginning; But the end thereof shall not be blessed.
Say not thou, I will recompense evil; \add But\add* wait on the \sc Lord\sc*, and he shall save thee.
Divers weights \add are\add* an abomination unto the \sc Lord\sc*; And a false balance \add is\add* not good.
Manâ€™s goings \add are\add* of the \sc Lord\sc*; How can a man then understand his own way?
\add It is\add* a snare to the man \add who\add* devoureth \add that which is\add* holy, And after vows to make inquiry.
A wise king scattereth the wicked, And bringeth the wheel over them.
The spirit of man \add is\add* the candle of the \sc Lord\sc*, Searching all the inward parts of the belly.
Mercy and truth preserve the king: And his throne is upholden by mercy.
The glory of young men \add is\add* their strength: And the beauty of old men \add is\add* the gray head.
The blueness of a wound cleanseth away evil: So \add do\add* stripes the inward parts of the belly.
